title: Native American History and Culture

vocab.kid_friendly_definition: The first people who lived in America before other people came from other countries.
A group of Native American people who lived together and shared the same culture.
Land set aside for Native American tribes to live on.
Traditions and culture passed down from your ancestors.
Family members who lived long ago.
Something that is very special and important to a group's beliefs.
A community gathering or celebration that shares Native culture through dance, music, and traditions.
The original peoples of a place and their descendants.
Groups of people with their own government and land.
The right of a group to govern themselves.

teachingNotes: Use respectful, accurate information about diverse tribes. Avoid stereotypes. Focus on contributions and continuing culture.
